Header: New Accommodation Block at SFHQ-E Opened
Content: A new accommodation block, constructed within a short period for the benefit of Other Ranks serving the Security Force Headquarters - East (SFHQ-E) at Welikanda was vested in the soldiers by the Commander of the Army, Lieutenant General Mahesh Senanayake who was in the East in connection with a series of other events during the weekend (30 - 31 March). This new accommodation complex was constructed by the troops of Corps of Engineer Services (CES), headed by Captain V.H.G.N.R Janasinghe, the Garrison Engineer, Welikanda under the guidance of Major General Aruna Jayasekera, Commander, Security Forces - East and senior Officers in the SFHQ-E. The construction in earnest began during the tenure of Major General Santhusitha Pananwala who was the former Commander Security Forces â€“ East before he went on retirement. An alms-giving for 100 Buddhist monks was also conducted to mark the opening of this building. Maha Sangha invoked blessings on members of the Army during the ceremony.
